revision.comment: Bringing up to date with new config system.

understanding.p: A documentation set is a collection of one or more related topic sets. A documentation set generally contains all the documentation related to a single product or service.

In SPFE, a documentation set is simply a particular build configuration. Topic source files do not contain anything that ties them to a specific documentation set. Therefore, you can define as many documentation sets as you like, simply by writing new documentation set configuration files. This makes it easy to reuse topics in different documentation sets. It also makes it easy to set up different build configurations for use during the development process.

planning-question.planning-question-title: Do I need a documentation set?

planning-question-body.p: Yes. The SPFE build requires a Documentation Set as a build target.

It is not necessary to create a collection of topic sets; you use a single topic set to include all your topics. However, if you use a documentation set, you can present multiple topic sets in a specific order in the table of contents in the output. A documentation set also enables you to reuse topic sets in different documentation sets.

planning-question.planning-question-title: Do I always have to build the entire documentation set

planning-question-body.p: If your documentation set is large, it may take a long time to build. If you are working on a single topic set and you want to do frequent builds of that topic set, you may not want to have to build the entire documentation set each time. SPFE does not provide a way to build topic sets individually. However, because a documentation set is to inexpensive to set up, you can create a documentation set that contains just the topic set you are working on and build that.

doing.p: To add a documentation set, you create a documentation set configuration file. A documentation set configuration file is a configuration file that includes the /spfe/doc-set element. You need the following mandatory attributes and elements:

li.p: /spfe/doc-set/doc-set-id: The ID of the documentation set. The build system uses the value to create a directory name and it must be a valid directory name in the operating system that runs the build system.
/spfe/doc-set/title: The title of the documentation set to display in the output.

/spfe/doc-set/topic-set-type-order: The order in which you want to present the topic sets in the table of contents of the documentation set. The type of a topic set is defined by the /spfe/topic-set/topic-set-type setting in the topic set configuration file.

/spfe/doc-set/topic-sets: The list of the topic sets to include in the documentation set. The value of the /spfe/doc-set/topic-sets/topic-set/topic-set-id setting should match the /spfe/topic-set/topic-set-id for the topic set. The /spfe/doc-set/topic-sets/topic-set/href attribute is the URL of the topic set configuration file.

doing.p: The following shows the documentation set configuration for the SPFE documentation set:

doing.p: This documentation set includes three topic sets, each with their own configuration file, which is specified by the /spfe/doc-set/topic-sets/topic-set/href setting. The path is relative to the location of the configuration file that defines the /spfe/doc-set element. Each topic set configuration file defines a /spfe/topic-set/topic-set-type element that matches one of the values in the /spfe/doc-set/topic-set-type-order element.

To add an index page for the documentation set, you need to add a topic set that includes an index topic and includes the topic set in the list of topic sets. For example, the topic set spfe-docs-home contains the index topic for the SPFE documentation set.

Run the spfe build tool and specify the configuration file that contains the /spfe/doc-set element as the first parameter. If you see the topic sets that your documentation set includes in the table of contents you have successfully added a documentation set.
